intro: Gomphia curvata, commonly known as the twisted gomphia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and slender, often zigzagging stems. Gomphia curvata is adapted to grow in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
